abstract: The NPR host, who took a leave of absence while her husband worked for the Obama campaign, will return to the news organization in February as a guest host and special correspondent.
snippet: The NPR host, who took a leave of absence while her husband worked for the Obama campaign, will return to the news organization in February as a guest host and special correspondent.
lead_paragraph: 1:50 p.m. | Updated Michele Norris, the NPR host who took a 15-month leave of absence while her husband worked for the Obama campaign, will return to the public radio network in February, NPR said Thursday.

headline.main: Michele Norris to Return to NPR in New Role
headline.print_headline: Returning NPR Host Will Consider Other Things
